oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Random hypersurfaces and embedding curves in surfaces over finite fields
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gunther, Joseph
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Number Theory
Mathematics - Algebraic Geometry
11G25, 11G20, 14G15, 14J70, 11M38, 14N05
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We use Poonen's closed point sieve to prove two independent results. First, we show that the obvious obstruction to embedding a curve in a smooth surface is the only obstruction over a perfect field, by proving the finite field analogue of a Bertini-type result of Altman and Kleiman. Second, we prove a conjecture of Vakil and Wood on the asymptotic probability of hypersurface sections having a prescribed number of singularities.
Comment: 9 pages; to appear in Journal of Pure and Applied Algebra
